main event: Pilots observed a bright green object in the sky while flying over Salinas, California on May 15, 1954.
interesting points: The object was described as having a variable tail resembling a missile., The pilots estimated the number of objects to be 2., The sighting lasted for approximately 8 seconds., The conclusion classified the object as an astronomical meteor, specifically a fireball meteor., The object was descending on a straight path and then disappeared and reappeared within 1-2 seconds.
sighted object: bright green object with a variable tail
witness description: military pilots and officers from the Air Force
